Nick,
 
I'm sure your gonna be a great researcher.
If I can help let me kn=
ow.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: thegreatwolf=
@...: Sun, 13 Jan 2008 20:33:41 -0500Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] B=
ox in the morning




Hey Bruce, I didn't mean to come across annoyed or of=
fended by your comment.  I was just saying incase it came across like I was=
 ignoring the box.  I agree that it isn't a toy and to pay attention to it =
when doing a session. 


On Jan 9, 2008, at 10:51 AM, bruce halliday wrote:=





Nick, You are a new member and a possible researcher so I do not want =
to get off on the wrong footIt sounds like you may have taken what I said a=
s criticism, It was not meant to be.Just experienced advice. There are some=
 researchers that believe it is beneficial to leave a box running and unatt=
ended, so that our spirit friends can "imprint" to the frequency of the box=
 That is not at all necessary, Spirit techs do need to imprint to certain b=
oxes but do so through two way communicationyou see they also imprint the e=
nergy signature of the user of the box also. And that can only be accomplis=
hed through communicative interaction during a session. If the box is left =
unattended they may only accomplish half of what they need to do. Also I ha=
ve had first hand experience with certain researchers that do practice this=
 lackadaisical us of a box and had begun to get less and less communication=
 during attempts at actual sessions and eventually nothing but negative ent=
ities coming through.I am not saying this is solely due to doing an absent =
session which is what I have come to call it, It entails man6y factors. But=
 the absent session practice definitely contributes to the ultimate failure=
 of communication. Nick, it is better for you to establish solid research p=
ractices in the beginning that will serve to enhance your communication ski=
lls and growth in the future. Remember your spirit contacts or "technicians=
" will become not only the facilitators of your link and communication from=
 theother side but they will become your trusted friends and protectors. yo=
u would never leave your buddy on the phone and go on to something else whi=
le he remained on the line calling for you to speak with him. Our spirit fr=
iends where people just like usat one time and the emotions we carry in the=
 physical also carry over to our spirit lives. I hope you do not take this =
as preaching or criticism it is just experience from communicating with my =
own techs and friendsand gathering information on what they feel and expect=
 from us as researchers.Remember all we have to do is turn on a box and lis=
ten and record their job to send the communication no matter how short the =
phrase or word is a 1000x harder for them so don't you think they deserve a=
 100% of our attention when we open the lines of communication. Also in clo=
sing let me say that my belief on "imprinting" of a box is for boxes like F=
rank's box and the mini box, for the simplereason that they are individuall=
y made and each carry a slightly different frequency range, indicative to t=
hat particular box.The radio shack hack box on the other hand is manufactur=
ed in china most likely on an automated assembly line so eachcircuit board =
is exactly like the next, this being the case I believe that when our frien=
ds imprinted on the first of the RS boxesit was sufficient for most of the =
others. That is why people experience immediate communication right out of =
the box. So therefore the RS box does not need that grace period to "Imprin=
t" These comments and statements are my own hypothesis based on my own exte=
nsive research with every type of box that is made to dateand I am only off=
ering it so that it may help others to avoid the toil and mistakes that I h=
ave endured. thanks for giving me the soap box once again! Bruce
Bruce Hall=
iday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: thegreatwolf@...: We=
d, 9 Jan 2008 06:25:30 -0500Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Box in the morning


Jus=
t FYI, I had stopped checking my email at that time and was trying to get s=
omeone to say something.  I usually can't get my self to not pay attention =
to the box when i turn it on.

On Jan 8, 2008, at 9:19 AM, bruce halliday w=
rote:




Nick, My advice as a long time researcher is not to just turn the=
 box on and leave it running unless you intend to do a session and give you=
r friends on the other side that are workingextremely hard to send you the =
communication your undivided attention. It's kind of like calling someone o=
n the phone and when they start a conversation you decide toput the phone d=
own and focus your attention on other things. There are other researchers t=
hat feel that there is nothing wrong with this practice and do it on occasi=
onBut I have come to the understanding that it is deemed disrespectful and =
while you may be listening with one ear as you do something else, you will =
hear a loud curse word or nasty statement, that is their way of getting you=
r attention back. I have gotten numerous messages about the difficulty of t=
he attempts for them to communicate so when I turn the box on it gets my fu=
ll attention. just some experienced advice. As for them telling you to clos=
e the portal, it could have two meanings. Sometimes they refer to box thati=
s turned on and in use as a portal for the simple reason that each time we =
turn a box on to communicate it opens a direct open link between our realm =
and theirs so in essence it is an open door for anything to pass in or out.=
 that is why when I end a session I always ask my technician to bring back =
any spirits that may have come through the portal during the session and I =
ask for conformation and 10 times out of ten will get "OK" or "OK THEY ARE =
BACK" also they may have meant since you had the box running and where not =
doing a actual session to shut the box so that they could go and not have t=
o protect the open connection from any negative entities that where able cr=
oss through the openportal. A few researchers have been receiving numerous =
messages about the number 7 within the past month. The only known significa=
nce that the number 7 has in evp research is the 7 entities that controlled=
 communication back in the eighties and ninetiesduring the spiricom and lux=
embourg era. To receive this number in messages so often and by more than o=
ne researcher, odiouslyholds some importance which they have not been able =
or are not ready to convey. If you need any help or have any questions plea=
se feel free to ask. Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFro=
m: thegreatwolf@...: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 06:27:07 -0500Subject: [=
EVP-ITC] Box in the morning


Hey,Anyone have any odd problems in the morni=
ng with using it. I am sitting here checking my email so i just thought i'd=
 turn it on and... not check my email. Anywho.... Then right at about 6:20 =
i heard a voice say "Nicholas Etheridge please turn off the dsfnlsd" not qu=
ite sure what word it used... possibly portal. I just thought it was weird.=
 Also under all of the jumble and this voice speaking i heard a deep male v=
oice almost chanting "seven". Not sure if I actually heard this or its the =
want to have an excuse to stay home and not take the HSAs.Anyway.. just cur=
ious if anyone has gotten heard this or if they know something I don't abou=
t using the box in the morning.Peace,Nick
